articles.title: Anti-DPRK Racket of S. Korean Conservatives Flailed
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Visit Farm 
    Pongsan, September 1 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here Monday visited the stockbreeding branch of the Unjong Stock-breeding Cooperative Farm, North Hwanghae Province on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the DPRK.
 During the "Arduous March" and the forced march, working people in North Hwanghae Province built a scores of km-long road on a steep mountain range, created pasture on either side of the road, built reservoirs in valleys, constructed scores of barns and milk processing facilities, modern dwelling-houses and entertainment and service establishments, thus turning the area into a stock-breeding centre.    
 Being briefed on this change, the visitors looked round different places including the milk-processing room and cold-storage room and then enjoyed Pongsan Masque Dances given by farmers there.

articles.title: Seminar on Massacre of Koreans Held
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Racket of S. Korean Conservatives Flailed 
    Pyongyang, September 2 (KCNA) -- U Tae Sik, spokesman for the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils, reportedly issued a commentary on August 30 in denunciation of the anti-DPRK showdown racket of the south Korean anti-reunification conservative forces.
 The commentary charged that the ultra-right conservative forces kicked up an anti-DPRK racket again in front of Kwanghwamun in Seoul on August 29 to impair the DPRK flag and collectively assaulted a policeman who tried to check them.    
 The conservatives ran amuck, overawed by ever-mounting desire for reunification Taegu, and were bereft of reason for their critical plight, the commentary pointed out, stressing: The conservative forces who have betrayed the nation and the people and have been engrossed in pro-American flunkeyism are obviously near their end.
